**Council Readiness — Final Assessment**

✅ **All 9 evaluation areas now covered:**

1. **Problem & Pain Points** — Validated across 4 personas with specific frustrations
2. **Target Users** — Detailed segments with motivations and replacement behaviors
3. **Solution Mechanism** — Production-ready technical spec (MobileLLM-Pro, Qwen3-VL, NeuTTS-Nano, thermal management, fallback strategy)
4. **Competitive Landscape** — ✅ **NEW:** 5 specific competitors analyzed (Rick Steves, Google Lens, izi.TRAVEL, Questo, official Zürich app) with concrete differentiation
5. **Success Metrics** — Quantified KPIs (>95% accuracy, >5 turns, >5% conversion)
6. **MVP Scope** — Clear 3-phase roadmap, 5 landmarks + 2 characters, Altstadt pilot boundary
7. **Technical Feasibility** — Stack choices justified with hardware constraints and quantization strategy
8. **Business Model** — Freemium with pricing ($14.99 Explorer Pass, $9.99/mo Premium), museum rev-share
9. **Risks & Mitigations** — ✅ **NEW:** 5 critical risks addressed across technical (landmark ID degradation, thermal throttling), partnership (museum dependency), accuracy (hallucination), and adoption (conversion assumptions)

---

**What the council will receive:**

A 5,882-character PRD (version 4.0) that spans strategic vision, persona validation, 2026-era on-device ML architecture, privacy-first design, competitive positioning, business model, and risk planning. The technical feasibility agents will see sufficient detail to assess build viability. The market/UX agents will see persona pain points mapped to specific product features. The business agents will see freemium economics with rev-share strategy.

**No additional prep needed.** This is council-ready.

**→ Hit "Send to Council" when you're ready to proceed.**
